job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core software engineering task of building and maintaining data processing pipelines and calculation engines, which are integral parts of software applications.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
job_tasks.justification: This involves designing and implementing software architecture for data delivery, a fundamental software engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
job_tasks.justification: Enhancing the non-functional aspects of software applications (stability, performance, reliability) is a core software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the responsibility for the entire software lifecycle, a key aspect of software engineering ownership.

job_tasks.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
job_tasks.justification: Focusing on software trustworthiness and applying security standards is a critical part of secure software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
job_tasks.justification: Building CI/CD pipelines is a direct MLOps/DevOps task, crucial for software deployment and maintenance.

job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
job_tasks.justification: Automating testing within the software development lifecycle (design, code, build, release) falls under MLOps/DevOps practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
job_tasks.justification: Implementing observability and monitoring for product performance is a key MLOps/DevOps responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on improving the operational aspects of services, which is a software engineering concern related to reliability and uptime.

job_tasks.phrase: Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
job_tasks.justification: These are all core MLOps/DevOps activities related to modernizing infrastructure and deployment practices.

job_tasks.phrase: In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
job_tasks.justification: Contributing to the future vision of service delivery involves architectural and strategic software engineering considerations.

job_tasks.phrase: The focus is on high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the general objective of software development, emphasizing quality, security, and timely delivery.

soft_skills.justification: Explicitly states the need for communicative skills, which falls under communication and collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture.
soft_skills.justification: This involves understanding the business context (credit risk program) and translating it into architectural decisions and implementation.

soft_skills.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
soft_skills.justification: This emphasizes ownership of the product throughout its lifecycle, a key aspect of innovation and taking responsibility.

soft_skills.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
soft_skills.justification: Focus on trustworthiness and security standards relates to responsible development practices.

soft_skills.phrase: We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
soft_skills.justification: Sharing and teaching knowledge to team members is a direct indicator of communication and collaboration skills.

soft_skills.phrase: Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future. Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
soft_skills.justification: Driving future improvements and modernization initiatives demonstrates innovation and ownership.

soft_skills.phrase: In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
soft_skills.justification: Developing a future vision for services requires understanding business needs and strategic direction.

soft_skills.phrase: The Vortex teams operate according to the Scrum Agile development process.
soft_skills.justification: Working within an Agile Scrum process implies adaptability and a willingness to learn and apply agile methodologies.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on traditional software engineering tasks such as building and maintaining ETL solutions, implementing new architectures, improving application stability, and managing the full software lifecycle. It also emphasizes MLOps/DevOps practices like CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and observability. While it mentions 'big data' and 'calculations', there is no mention of AI/ML models, generative AI, LLMs, prompt engineering, or specific AI/ML algorithms. Therefore, the role is classified as a 'Software Engineer' as it does not involve AI/ML specialization.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the tasks and technologies involved. It explicitly describes traditional software engineering and MLOps/DevOps responsibilities without any mention of AI or ML models, making the classification straightforward.
